postcontent: Seller Stock #: XM9215TW Restrictions apply for some areas in the US, please read this entire ad carefully before bidding or offering to buy. This listing is for THREE magazines; winning buyer, however, may take any number of extras we have available at the same per-mag price with no additional shipping charges. Here are excellent quality 15 round blued steel magazine for the tried and true Taurus PT-92 and PT-99 Pistols made in Brazil. These also fit models PT92C; with some fitting to the mag release stud stop on the magazine, these can be readily made to fit models PT915, PT917 PT920 PT911, any 92 Type Taurus. These work fine in the compacts, but they will obviously protrude, just as a Government Mag works in an Officer Size, or a 5900 Magazine in a 6900 Smith & Wesson. They will not work in an ATI HP9; will not work in a Beretta 92; Will Not work on the seat spring of a John Deere 1947 H Manure Spreader. They will only work on the Taurus 92 series pistols we have mentioned above. Manufacturer is Taiwanese, probably HFC Company. Construction is all steel body and floor plate, steel spring and black high impact cartridge follower. Finish is smooth and excellent. Each magazine holds 15 rounds of 9mm ammunition. We sold a good manu of these exact same magazines in 2009 with excellent service results. They lock the slide back correctly when they are empty; and they free fall eject from current production 92 and 99 Tauruses like the one in some of our photos. Replacement pricing on the Factory Taurus Magazines is upwards of $50 apiece in our area. Our Single Mag Price is $39.00. title: For Trade:  Glock Gen 3 27 FDE LNIB
postcontent: Like new Glock 27 Gen 3 with the dark earth frame. 30 rounds have through this gun. Comes with two mags, original case with all factory documents. Has night sights and pearce magazine +1 pinky extensions. No 22s. Also please do not offer your Kahr Cm or Cw series, Ruger SR9, SR40 or SR45 or other handguns in the $300-$400 range for a straight trade. This Glock is LNIB being made in December of 2014 and under 30 rounds down the tube. This IS ALSO A FDE MODEL, therefore it did cost a little more than a standard Glock. It also did not come with Night Sights, I had to pay for those. So if anyone wishes to offer 500.00 for my Glock I will gladly take it, but you will get it with the factory sights, not night sights, factory trigger,not the 3.5lb trigger and factory mag base plates and not the mag extensions. It will also not come with the holster. However with all that being said, if you want a very nice Glock with very nice night sights, a nice crisp 3.5 pound trigger, mag extensions and a holster the cash or trade price is $600.00. I do not expect to get the $750.00 that I have in it. I just want people to be realistic when they look at other's firearms on here and not expect to get a Glock with this quality or any other quality handgun for next to nothing. I apologize if you can't afford the Glock, Sig or other quality handguns that you desire, but those of us on here that do have them please respect us and know that we have these guns because we do know a little something about guns in the first place. Thank you. And for those of you who I didn't piss off, please feel free to offer your trades. I will accept cheaper handguns if you are willing to make up the difference.

title: For Sale:  Spanish Civil War Mosin Nagant m91/30
postcontent:
This a 1936 Tula manufactured hex receiver m91/30 that was supplied to Spanish Communist forces during the Spanish Civil War. Has the correct "Made in USSR" stamp on the rear sight, Spanish property marked stock and wire sling loops. 

Numbers match on receiver, floorplate and buttplate. Bolt does not match as usual with these. All original and one of nicest ones I've seen.

I have put a few rounds through this and it shoots fine. The bluing and the stock show some wear. The bore is a bit dark and cruddy but the rifling is strong and it's not counterbored.

An inexpensive piece of history.

No trades please, if I didn't really need the cash I would keep this one.

Full bluing, beautiful stock, bore is a little dark and cruddy but the rifling is strong and it's not counterbored. Bolt renumbered to match receiver, floorplate does not match.

 I have put a few rounds through this and it work 100%. One of the nicer ones I've seen. All original and comes with an original Finn sling. Does have a small import mark on the bottom of the barrel.

No trades, if I didn't really need the cash I would keep this one.

title: For Sale:  (NEW) SilencerCo Salvo 12
postcontent: GREAT DEALS SELL QUICKLY, CHECK HERE FOR AVAILABILITY OR TO PURCHASE>(NEW) SilencerCo Salvo 12Everyone who owns a gun owns a shotgun. Until late last year, most of them had never been suppressed. The Salvo 12 is the first commercially-viable shotgun suppressor and represents an incredible advance in engineering and technology. The Salvo 12 is designed to operate with nearly all shotguns and ammunition on the market today including pump actions, semi autos, and inertia driven models. Due to the modularity of the Salvo 12, the shooter can remove sections to balance their sound suppression, weight, and length needs and can attach the Salvo to their favorite shotgun with choke mounts available in improved cylinder, modified, improved modified, and full. This adaptability makes the Salvo 12 ideal for use with sporting days, waterfowl, turkey hunting, home defense,and everything in between. At its full length of 12 inches, sound is brought down to 136.8 dB at the muzzle - well below the 140 dB hearing-safe threshold set by OSHA. Pair this sound reduction with a noticeable decrease in felt recoil, and after just a few rounds through the Salvo 12, you'll never go back to shooting unsuppressed again.KEY PERFORMANCE FEATURES:Attaches via choke mount to most commercially available gas operated, inertia driven, or pump action shotguns with barrels threaded for chokes.Modular design allows the user to shorten the silencer to 6",8", or 10" configurations to balance size, weight, and sound requirements.Rated for wadded shells up to 3" including buckshot and slugs.Can be shortened to 8" configuration and remain hearing safe at the ear.Noticeably reduces felt recoil.Choke mounts and rod kits sold separately - choke mounts available in improved cylinder, modified, improved modified, and full.The Salvo 12 is compatible with the following barrel and ammunition pairings.BARREL LENGTH                                      AMMUNITION10"-16"                                                           2 3/4" Shell, 1350 FPS16"+                                                                3" Shell, 1550 FPSSPECIFICATIONS:CALIBER: 12 GaugeMFG ID: SU823MUZZLE AVERAGE dB: 136.8WEIGHT: 34.5 ozLENGTH: 12.00"DIMENSIONS: 2.21" X 2.96"MATERIALS: Aluminum & Stainless SteelMSRP: 1,400.00

Some of our photos show such a pistol. Manufacturer is Steyr Mannlicher GmbH & Co KG of Steyr, Austria. Importer is Steyr Arms just to the south of us in Trussville, Alabama. All my Izzy's are gone and since I have a few people asking I decided to put a few more desirable / rare Tula's up for sale. I don't know what the production numbers were for a round receiver Tula but you hardly ever see one. I know after all these years of collecting I was only able to get my hands on a few (gotta love those big Russian stars on the receivers). These are mostly pre-war rifles (1938-1940) but likely saw battle. There are a few with rareish BRASS hand guard ends and a couple with nice factory repairs (always a plus for collectors - adds to the mystique). As always, all numbers match. First come / first served on getting to hand pick the best from the lot. If you buy a rifle I will throw in a 440 round spam can of silver tip milsurp ammo for $120. Yes, you might find a cheaper Mosin but it is well worth a few extra $$$ to get to hand pick one that you get to see instead of using mail order, paying for shipping, paying an FFL fee, and then finding out it was ran over by a tank in 1945 and is horrible looking. My rifles look great and all are still packed in cosmoline by the Russians who were waiting for WWIII to begin. Ask around, people know I have a quality collection. I will only sell a few rifles so make sure you jump on this. All rifles have matching numbers (including the bayonet !!!), a cleaning kit, and an oil/solvent canteen. Prices are extremely FIRM.

*** Oh, if you do not put I LOVE MOSIN somewhere in your email to me I will NOT reply. This is to keep the spam down. Again, if you do not put I LOVE MOSIN somewhere in your email to me I will NOT reply. ***

***** NOTE - I am looking for used 7.62x54r brass for reloading. If you shoot brass ammo please keep it instead of throwing it away and drop an email to me. I will buy it from you OR trade it for unfired military surplus rounds (silver tip). *****

If you cannot decide which rifle to pick my assistant will be happy to help you.

title: For Sale:  Colt 1911 Government Grips Ajax Imitation Ivory 45 Auto type GR12IP Any Standard Size 9mm 45 Gov’t New Old Stock No Go with Ambidextrous Safety
postcontent: Seller Stock #: GR12IP We’ve sold Ajax Grips for well over a decade with excellent results, both on our stock revolvers and pistols, and for our local Tennessee, Mississippi, and Alabama consumers. No other product from a Connecticut Company commands more respect here in the Mid South than Colt. Ajax polymer grips have just the right combination of strength and flexibility to fit perfectly and survive well, even under steady diets of +P ammunition in Lightweight Combat Commander pistols. Here is Ajax’s number 12IP, smooth imitation ivory finish. These will NOT fit a Government model that has an ambidextrous safety, and we have included photos of an ambidextrous safety on a 1911 Taurus. We do not recommend non-gunsmiths grinding these off, folk can ruin the right panel if they don’t know what they’re doing. Other than that, these are perfect fits for any traditional 1911 Government Model type pistol with a standard size grip frame, and whose grip screws measure exactly 3 inches between their centers. Models include Armscor 1911, Auto Ordnance 1911, Colt Government models, Aces and Gold Cups, Detonics full size, Kimber, Llama full size, Metro Arms, Remington 1911, Ruger SR1911, Taurus 1911s, and Umarex 1911 clones, to name a few. Caliber of the pistol does not matter. These will not fit a Compact variant that measures 2 1/2 inches between the screws; will not fit a Star Pistol, will not fit the door lever of a 1937 Dodge Blue Bird School Bus. They will only fit 1911 Government Model Pistols with full size grip frames with right hand shooter safety like the one showing in some of our photos. Manufacturer, of course, was Ajax Custom Grips of Dallas, Texas. These grips are old stock Texas production that we found in an old Southern warehouse; Ajax now makes its home in Seneca, Missouri. These grips have not been shown, installed, handled or even displayed until our photographer opened them. We’re offering the Ajax 12IP, Imitation Ivory Grips for 1911 Government type Pistols only, the grips in the photos or a set of their identical mates for only $ 29.00. Grip screws are not included, but many times we have them available in sets of 4.Shipping.Grips, Magazines, slings, holsters, scopes, mounts, parts & most any small light items, entire accessory orders only $10.00 total shipping no matter how many a person buys. $10.00 for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico, and gun parts to PR civilians must ship to an FFL. title: For Sale:  AAC MPW 16" 300 BLK KAC URX 3.1 Rail 100 rounds of ammo
postcontent:
Here is a very lightly used (~100 rounds) Advanced Armarment Corp MPW in 300 AAC Blackout. Awesome gun.  Runs perfectly with mil spec AAC BCG.  Comes with box and all paperwork.  On an Anderson lower with fantastic trigger. Magpul stock and Bravo Company BCM Mod 3 grip. No Trades. Cash Only. I'll include 100 rounds of ammo with the sale. 

I'm happy to answer any questions you may have. Please feel free to contact me.
Thanks for looking!

A 30 caliber rifle the size of an AR15 5.56mm caliber rifle - without a reduction in magazine capacity. The AAC MPW in 300 AAC Blackout uses ordinary 223/5.56mm  magazines for a full 30 round capacity, and is available in 9, 12.5, and 16 inch barrels.*

Components are of premium quality. The 1:7 twist barrel is nitrided to provide extreme corrosion resistance and high hardness for a long life - outperforming chrome-lined barrels for longevity without the potential impediments to accuracy. The muzzle is threaded 5/8-24 and includes an AAC 51-tooth BLACKOUT™ flash suppressor with the complete upper. A Knight’s Armament free-floating URX III helps maintain accuracy while providing for the mounting of accessories. The bolt carrier group’s nickel boron (Ni-B) UCT EXO coating has a very high hardness and lower friction than either chrome or nickel teflon. There is also a base layer of high-phosphorous electroless nickel that ensures the extreme corrosion protection that is absent from other Nickel Boron carriers that use a single, thinner layer. The bolt itself is Carpenter 158® phosphated shot-peened steel to ensure precise dimensions with no concerns for hydrogen embrittlement in the critical lug area. A special green o-ring that is tested to not bind even at -40 degrees F is standard. The extractor spring is made from premium ultra-strong wire and is a low fatigue design to ensure the longest possible life. The extractor pin made from 300 ksi S2 tool steel - not the much lower strength S7 more commonly used. 

The recommended optional sound suppressor is the AAC 762-SDN-6™, which provides an average of 39.3 dB reduction with subsonic ammunition.
